head.supplied: Dr Hooker Kew ¶ Sir, ¶ ¶ I do myself the honor to call to your recollection that the Commissioners for the Exhibition held in London in 1862, had the pleasure of presenting, by the direction of the G...

div.p: Unit 6, pp. 28-9, VPRS 927 title, VA title, Public Record Office, Victoria.

I do myself the honor to call to your recollection that the Commissioners for the Exhibition held in London in 1862, had the pleasure of presenting, by the direction of the Government of Victoria a large collection of Timber, the produce of this country prepared classified & named by Dr Mueller, the well known Botanist. It is the desire of the Commissioners appointed for furthering the objects of the Universal Exhibition to be held in Paris in 1867 to cause the timbers of Victoria to be well represented. However they have to regret that the smallness of the funds placed at their disposal restricts their outlay within narrow limits.

Under these circumstances, I am emboldened to request that if there be no paramount obstacles in the way, you will have the goodness to allow a portion of the woods of Victoria now in the museum of Kew to be placed at the disposal of the Commissioners for Victoria.

I have written by this mail to Mr De Salis suggesting that he should communicate with you on the subject, & as it is probable that you will send to Paris some of the timbers presented to the Museum of Kew by N. S. Wales in 1862, those which you might kindly permit to be taken from the Victorian collection might be transmitted to Paris with them whereby expense might be [...]
both the contributions might be entrusted to the same responsibility.

div.p: I have the honor to be,

div.p: W. F. de Salis Esqr [38] [Cannon] Street London.
